title: Baseball Tonight font -- ESPN -- extra pics added!
content:
I can’t figure out this awesome block semi-serif used by ESPN on the show Baseball Tonight. Sorry for the tiny sample size, but I hope someone can point me in the right direction. It seems generic enough to not be a custom face, but.. you never know.

Cleaned up the original image, which was a TV capture:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207040819im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/baseballtonightfont5_4684.png)

 [‹ Body typeface in Crossway Book](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207040819/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49697 "Go to previous forum topic") [90's Distressed Type ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207040819/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49741 "Go to next forum topic")
author: wizard7926

comments.content: How odd. Is it a slab? Is it a sans? Is it slab sans?

I don’t know! It’s very quirky, hopefully I can get some more sample shots of it.. it’s really a mix of slab and sans, but not exactly either. It could be modified, but it looks so generic and clean.. it’s just perplexing!

After grabbing a few more screen captures from tonight’s show, there seems to be a fully-sans version, as well as a modified slab version. Check these shots out, specifically the “ACKS” in both “DIAMONDBACKS” and “JACKSON”.

Each link notes the text shown in the screen grab:

 [7TH INNING](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207040819/http:/img523.imageshack.us/img523/8413/bbt7thinnix6.png)  
 [WEB GEMS](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207040819/http:/img262.imageshack.us/img262/6429/bbtwebgemsii2.png)  
 [FELIPE LOPEZ](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207040819/http:/img262.imageshack.us/img262/6650/bbtlopez1ge5.png)  
 [SCOTT BAKER](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207040819/http:/img261.imageshack.us/img261/3971/bbtbaker1by1.png)  
 [CONOR JACKSON](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207040819/http:/img87.imageshack.us/img87/6573/bbtdbacks1ur7.png)
Looks like a custom version of [Stratum 1](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207040819/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/stratum1/index.html)

It does look like Stratum, squished a little bit, and they added some serifs on the one version.. thanks, zevbiz!

.. surprised it’s not listed under “Stratum Projects,” as Baseball Tonight is a very popular ESPN show..
